{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3568599,"name":"E DiCarlo","username":"E_DiCarlo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ecae2f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T00:12:03.927Z","cooked":"

We are having issues with creating autonomous paths.

After successfully using a trajectory to drive near the Reef, then successfully using Limelight to target the Reef with field coordinates taken from the AprilTag, the next command to drive to the coral station using a trajectory does not work. The robot stops moving, although Dashboard statements show that the final trajectory command does start and end. However, when running each of these commands separately, they work. We don’t have much experience with instant commands (or using CommandScheduler.getInstance().schedule). If we disable after the first 2 commands run, then the third command will run. It seems like we somehow need to reset something (a pose?) at the end of the second command (??). Any advice would be appreciated!

For example, we tried doing these 3 sequential commands:
new DriveFwd(s_Swerve, false, 6).withTimeout(2),
new FieldCentricTargetRight(s_Swerve).withTimeout(1.5),
new DriveReverse(s_Swerve, true, -10).withTimeout(2.5)

Here are the links to those commands (and to MetricDriveFwdSideTurn which is called at the end of FieldCentricTargetRight):

Field Centric Target Right

Metric Drive Fwd Side Turn

Drive Fwd

Drive Reverse

I presume that the issue is your alignment instant command schedules a command outside of the SequentialCommandGroup, and since it shares subsystem requirements, it will cancel the original command group. You could have a function that returns the desired command instead

you could us asproxy() to make sure that the subsystem requirements for the commands don’t confuse commandscheduler

Thank you for this suggestion. A few years back I had a different but similar issue with sequential commands and someone on Chief Delphi suggested using asProxy() and it worked. I’ll try this out this afternoon.

Would it be only the CommandScheduler.getInstance().schedule(new MetricDriveFwdSideTurn) command that is called in FieldCentricTargetRight that should have the asProxy, or would any of the commands within the sequential command group MetricDriveFwdSideTurn also need asProxy (such as the swerveControllerCOmmand called at the end)?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T10:44:10.950Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":15.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496922,"topic_slug":"issue-with-running-sequential-commands","display_username":"E DiCarlo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70441,"username":"SnappleBot","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b3f665/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30734,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/issue-with-running-sequential-commands/496922/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569061,"name":"","username":"SnappleBot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/b3f665/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T15:01:03.063Z","cooked":"

just the sequential command itself needs the asproxy()

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-26T15:01:03.063Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":37,"readers_count":36,"score":7.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":496922,"topic_slug":"issue-with-running-sequential-commands","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":30734,"username":"E_DiCarlo","name":"E DiCarlo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ecae2f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70441,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/issue-with-running-sequential-commands/496922/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3569064,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-26T15:05:15.059Z","cooked":"

You typically shouldn’t manually schedule commands from other commands; it can easily lead to obscure and hard-to-debug control flows.

You should try to represent this behavior with a Trigger binding or a composite Command; this will make the requirement interaction easier to see and to think about. asProxy is a scalpel, not a magic wand, so you really have to know and understand what you’re doing with it before you use it.

you can also use getrequirements() on a command and put that into shuffleboard to see what subsystems it says it needs to see if there are conflicts between commands
